text:
Saudi Investment Initiative Concludes

01 Nov 2019

With the conclusion of the sessions of the third session of the “Future of Investment Initiative” in Riyadh yesterday, a number of state leaders anticipated that Saudi Arabia will host the G20 summit next year, confirming their confidence in Riyadh's ability to make the summit a success, given the potential and expertise the Kingdom has and its impact on the global economy. For his part, Saudi Minister of State Dr. Ibrahim bin Abdul Aziz Al-Assaf that his country is still preparing for the summit of leaders of the Group of Twenty, headed by 2020, noting that many meetings were held at a high level under the chairmanship of Prince Mohammed bin Salman bin Abdul Aziz Crown Prince and Deputy Chairman Ministers and g He pointed out that the Saudi economy is the largest in the region, pointing out that the Kingdom plays a special role in the Group of 20 as a developing country and has common issues with developing countries, and therefore plays a bridging role between the two sides. Enhancing the Gulf economy in an integrated manner, calling for the need to align economic growth with the actual movement of structural reforms, with the need to prioritize digital transformation in the government sector.
